Package doa.engine.net

Class DoaServer

java.lang.Object
doa.engine.net.DoaServer
public class DoaServer
extends java.lang.Object
Standard issue socket server. An object of this class represents a physical server which can send and receive messages to/from connected clients.

In order to create and use a server, refer to the code segment below. * 
 
 DoaServer sv = new DoaServer(); // create a server instance
 sv.open(27015); // open the server and start listening at port 27015
 //...
 sv.broadcast(-1, new DoaNetPacket<>("Is it me you're looking for?")); // broadcast a packet containing a string, -1 denoted server is the source of the message
 sv.close(); // disconnect from all the clients and close the server
Since:
DoaEngine 3.0
Version:
3.0
Author:
Doga Oruc

  • Constructor Details

    • DoaServer

      public DoaServer()
      Constructor

  • Method Details

    • open

      public int open​(int port)
      Opens the server on the specified port and binds it. A valid port value is between 0 and 65535. A port number of zero will let the system pick up an ephemeral port in a bind operation. Port forwarding is required to receive connection from outside the LAN.
      Parameters:
      port - the port number this server will get bound to
      Returns:
      the port number bounded to server or -1 upon failure to bind

    • close

      public void close()
      Closes all connections to the clients and shuts the server down. After this method returns, the server cannot be opened again. Applications that require to re-open a closed server, must create a new server.

    • broadcast

      public void broadcast​(int senderID, @NotNull @NotNull DoaNetPacket<java.io.Serializable> packet)
      Sends a message to all connected clients, except the sender itself. A senderID of -1 indicates the server itself is the sender of the broadcast, any other valid ID indicates a client with that ID is the sender.
      Parameters:
      senderID - ID of the sender, -1 for server sourced broadcast
      packet - message to send
